title: Instructional Design for Self-Regulated Learning Strategies to Improve Online Learning Engagement

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic online learning tools and understanding of mathematics curriculum content
context.additional_context: Environment where pre-service teachers experience mathematics learning design applying self-regulated strategies in a smartphone-based, limited-technology setting

learning_goals: Learners can propose three or more online lesson designs incorporating self-regulated learning strategies (e.g., goal setting, time management, self-assessment)
Learners can implement project-based solutions to enhance online learning engagement through peer feedback and self-reflection
Learners can develop two or more effective self-regulated learning activities within technological constraints (smartphone-centric environments)

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
